metadata.Description: Energy derived from the sun's radiation and converted into usable forms such as electricity or heat.

level 1.Description: Solar energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Solar energy funds Research and Development to improve solar panel efficiency and develop new technologies.
Solar energy focuses on Renewable Energy Sources as a sustainable and clean energy solution.
Solar energy is used in Solar Power Plants to generate electricity from sunlight.
Solar energy partners with the Electric Vehicle Industry to promote the use of solar-powered vehicles.
Solar energy contributes to Climate Change Mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Solar energy monitors the performance of solar panels to ensure optimal efficiency.
Solar energy targets Rural Electrification to provide clean and affordable energy access to remote areas.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

subelement_relations.Description: Solar panels are devices that convert sunlight into electricity. They are a key component of solar energy systems and play a crucial role in harnessing renewable energy.
Solar cells, also known as photovoltaic cells, are the building blocks of solar panels. They convert sunlight directly into electricity through the photovoltaic effect.
Solar inverters are electronic devices that convert the direct current (DC) electricity generated by solar panels into alternating current (AC) electricity suitable for use in homes and businesses.

Solar batteries store excess electricity generated by solar panels for later use. They help in achieving energy independence and enable the utilization of solar power even during non-sunny periods or at night.

Solar thermal systems use sunlight to heat water or other fluids, which can be used for various purposes such as space heating, water heating, and industrial processes. They are an alternative to traditional fossil fuel-based heating systems.
